column4: muelli, both .deb programs are dependent on each other and the dependency recommendation is the other program for both programs
both .deb programs are dependent on each other and the dependency recommendation is the other program for both programs
It's called a circular dependency and shouldn't happen. Report it as a bug.
although I wonder, which is the current stable version in ubuntu of gcc?
i downloaded from packages.ubuntu.com the one for lucid
It handles all the dependencies like magic.
There's a tool for you, give me a sec

Obviously there's the possibility to install from CD repositories, but there's a neater package that produces shell scripts that download the packages required, which you can put on an USB drive, execute on another machine, plug the USB drive into your old machine, and it will use that as a repository.
